definition.name: accounts_contact_information

fields.name: address
fields.description: Registered address of the account holder (residential or business).

fields.name: email
fields.description: Primary email address associated with the account.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Primary phone number for contacting the account holder.

definition.description:
Stores customer contact details including address, email, and phone number.
Used to support KYC, identity verification, and investigative communication.

definition.name: accounts_transaction_limits

fields.name: max_num_transactions
fields.description: Maximum number of transactions allowed for this account in a specified monitoring window.

fields.name: max_transaction_limit
fields.description: Maximum allowed value per transaction for this account.

definition.description:
Captures transaction constraints for an account to detect threshold breaches.
Used in flagging high-volume or high-value behavior, often linked to structuring.

definition.name: accounts

fields.name: _id
fields.description: MongoDB internal object ID for the account document.

fields.name: account_id
fields.description: Bank-assigned unique account number or reference ID.

fields.name: contact_information
fields.description: Nested object storing address, email, and phone number of the account holder.

fields.name: entity_type
fields.description: Type of account ownership. Common values include: 'Individual', 'Business', 'NGO'.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the account holder (individual or organization).

fields.name: risk
fields.description:
Risk rating assigned to the account for AML purposes. Expected values: Low, Medium, High.
Higher values may require additional scrutiny or transaction monitoring.

fields.name: transaction_limits
fields.description: Nested object containing volume and value thresholds for transaction monitoring.

definition.description:
Primary entity storing account-level metadata including owner identity,
risk classification, contact details, and transactional limits. 
Used by AML systems to assess risk and investigate flagged activity.

definition.name: aml_cases_aml_flags

fields.name: cross_border
fields.description:
True if the transaction crosses international jurisdictions or involves
foreign counterparties; often associated with regulatory complexity.

fields.name: darknet
fields.description:
True if the transaction is suspected to involve darknet activity such as
anonymized crypto wallets, hidden marketplaces, or obfuscated origins.

fields.name: structuring
fields.description:
True if the transaction pattern suggests structuring behavior — breaking
large amounts into smaller ones to avoid detection thresholds.

definition.description:
Captures boolean flags representing specific laundering techniques observed
in AML investigations. These include cross-border activity, structuring, and
darknet-related patterns.

definition.name: aml_cases

fields.name: _id
fields.description: MongoDB internal ObjectId of the AML case.

fields.name: aml_flags
fields.description: Nested flags indicating presence of specific laundering techniques (e.g., structuring, darknet).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Transaction value in USD (or bank’s base currency).

fields.name: beneficiary_address
fields.description: Address associated with the beneficiary receiving the funds.

fields.name: beneficiary_id
fields.description: Internal system ID of the beneficiary entity.

fields.name: beneficiary_name
fields.description: Full legal name of the transaction beneficiary.

fields.name: originator_address
fields.description: Address associated with the originator sending the funds.

fields.name: originator_id
fields.description: Internal system ID of the originator entity.

fields.name: originator_name
fields.description: Full legal name of the originator initiating the transaction.

fields.name: transaction_date
fields.description: Date of the transaction in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).

fields.name: transaction_id
fields.description: Transaction reference number or system-assigned ID.

definition.description:
Represents individual AML cases triggered by flagged transactions. Contains
transaction metadata, originator and beneficiary details, and embedded laundering
risk indicators (via aml_flags). Used by investigators to prioritize and
resolve suspicious activity.

functions.name: get_daily_sanctions_report_v2
functions.description:
Runs the daily sanctions report v2 automation in PromptQL.
    Uses a specific report date instead of lookback days.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to yesterday.

procedures.name: post_sanctions_report_v2_to_slack
procedures.description:
Runs the daily sanctions report v2 and posts results to the HoundQL Slack channel.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to yesterday.
        custom_message: Optional custom message to include with the report

procedures.name: run_sanctions_report_with_custom_date
procedures.description:
Runs the sanctions report v2 with a custom date.
    Optionally posts to Slack based on the post_to_slack parameter.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to yesterday.
        post_to_slack: Whether to post results to Slack (default: True)

procedures.name: schedule_daily_sanctions_report_v2
procedures.description:
Schedules the daily sanctions report v2 to be sent at a specific time.
    This is a placeholder - actual scheduling would depend on your infrastructure.
    
    Args:
        time: Time to send report (HH:MM format, UTC)
        default_date_offset: How many days back from current date to report on (default: 1 for yesterday)

definition.name: get_daily_sanctions_report_v2
definition.description:
Runs the daily sanctions report v2 automation in PromptQL.
    Uses a specific report date instead of lookback days.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to yesterday.

definition.name: post_sanctions_report_v2_to_slack
definition.description:
Runs the daily sanctions report v2 and posts results to the HoundQL Slack channel.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to yesterday.
        custom_message: Optional custom message to include with the report

definition.name: public_customers

fields.name: account
fields.description: Customer's primary account number in the banking system.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Residential or business address associated with the customer.

fields.name: blacklisted
fields.description: Boolean flag indicating if the customer is on the internal or external AML blacklist.

fields.name: customer_id
fields.description: Unique internal customer identifier.

fields.name: dob
fields.description: Date of birth of the customer in YYYY-MM-DD format.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Full legal name of the customer.

fields.name: nationality
fields.description: Country of citizenship of the customer.

fields.name: pep_status
fields.description: Boolean flag indicating Politically Exposed Person (PEP) status. `true` means the customer is a PEP; `false` means they are not.

fields.name: risk_level
fields.description: Customer's AML risk classification. Expected values are `Low`, `Medium`, and `High`. `Low` indicates minimal risk, `Medium` suggests moderate risk based on jurisdiction or activity, and `High` signals elevated AML risk requiring enhanced monitoring.

definition.description: Stores customer identity and AML risk metadata used for anti-money laundering screening. Includes critical flags such as PEP status, blacklist status, and risk classification. Supports compliance workflows and suspicious activity detection.

definition.name: public_financial_transfers

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Transaction amount in the original payment currency.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date of the transaction.

fields.name: is_laundering
fields.description: Boolean flag indicating if the transaction is suspected of laundering activity (true/false).

fields.name: laundering_type
fields.description: Type of laundering behavior detected (e.g., structuring, layering).

fields.name: payment_currency
fields.description: Currency used by the sender for the payment.

fields.name: payment_type
fields.description: Type of transaction (e.g., wire, ACH, cash).

fields.name: received_currency
fields.description: Currency received by the beneficiary.

fields.name: receiver_account
fields.description: Bank account number of the receiver.

fields.name: receiver_bank_location
fields.description: Geographical location of the receivers bank.

fields.name: sender_account
fields.description: Bank account number of the sender.

fields.name: sender_bank_location
fields.description: Geographical location of the senders bank.

fields.name: time
fields.description: Time of transaction (HH:MM:SS format).

fields.name: transaction_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the transaction.

definition.description: Stores financial transaction records including AML related flags and currency details.

definition.name: public_sars

fields.name: customer_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the customer associated with the SAR.

fields.name: filed_date
fields.description: Timestamp when the SAR was filed.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Text description providing the rationale for the SAR filing.

fields.name: sar_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the Suspicious Activity Report.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Current review status of the SAR (e.g., pending, reviewed, escalated).

fields.name: transaction_id
fields.description: Identifier of the transaction linked to the SAR, if applicable.

definition.description: Stores Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) filed against transactions or customers, including reasons and filing dates.

definition.name: run_sanctions_report_with_custom_date
definition.description:
Runs the sanctions report v2 with a custom date.
    Optionally posts to Slack based on the post_to_slack parameter.
    
    Args:
        report_date: Specific date for the report (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to yesterday.
        post_to_slack: Whether to post results to Slack (default: True)

definition.name: sanctions

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the sanctions record.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Known address of the sanctioned entity or individual.

fields.name: entity_name
fields.description: Full name of the sanctioned entity or individual.

fields.name: entity_type
fields.description: Classification of the entity (e.g., individual, organization).

fields.name: list_type
fields.description: Type of sanctions list (e.g., OFAC, UN, EU).

fields.name: listed_date
fields.description: Date when the entity was added to the sanctions list.

fields.name: program
fields.description: Name of the sanctions program under which the entity is listed (e.g., SDN, NPWMD).

definition.description: Stores entities and individuals listed under financial sanctions programs, including key identifying details and listing metadata.

definition.name: schedule_daily_sanctions_report_v2
definition.description:
Schedules the daily sanctions report v2 to be sent at a specific time.
    This is a placeholder - actual scheduling would depend on your infrastructure.
    
    Args:
        time: Time to send report (HH:MM format, UTC)
        default_date_offset: How many days back from current date to report on (default: 1 for yesterday)
